snippet: While President Obama would work to increase grants and extend a tax credit, Mitt Romney would work to make financial aid available for students who “need it most,” an aide said.
abstract: Pres Obama and Mitt Romney are offering voters vastly different solutions to the problem of the rising cost of college tuition; Obama would work to increase grants and extend a tax credit, while Romney's policy proposals reflect his desire to reduce federal spending and to shift more government functions to the private sector.
lead_paragraph: While President Obama would work to increase grants and extend a tax credit, Mitt Romney would work to make financial aid available for students who “need it most,” an aide said.

headline.seo: 2 Campaigns Diverge on Confronting Rising Cost of College
headline.main: Private Sector Role Is at Heart of Campaigns’ Split on College Costs
headline.print_headline: Private Sector Role Is at Heart of Campaigns’ Split on College Costs
